Reviews.Title: “Lousy Hotel - very overpriced”
Reviews.Author: penny_waight
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Amsterdam and we used this hotel. It was very very poor. The rooms are very tatty with peeled and dirty wall paper, tiles falling off in the bathroom and generally very down at heel. It was not good value for money. The breakfast is a complete rip off 20euros per person per breakfast. Really really expensive and not worth the money. Good situation very close to most things and a easy walk to the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: James P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with great staff who are always to happy to help. We stayed for two nights and this is the second time we have stopped here. The hotel is a great base to explore the city and is right in the middle of all the action. The hotel has the added benefit of being very quiet at night therefore ensuring a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: beckyb78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night only but overall we were impressed. This hotel is clearly old and in need of some repair but for the price we paid we can't complain. The hotel is a 3 minute walk from Central Station so very well located and the room was surprisingly quiet considering. The staff were very friendly and room service was not as expensive as some hotels we have stayed in previously. The room was a large twin with plenty of room for luggage and the bathroom was also pretty big. I would stay here again but wouldn't pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “OK for broke 20somethings, barely”
Reviews.Author: SprezzaturaCA
Reviews.Content: Thin walls, uncomfortable bed, a battered looking room with peeling wallpaper and a rundown carpet, and a tiny closet so shoddy that it couldn't hold my coat on a hanger without the rod falling down. Stayed 1 night then checked out and found someplace more comfortable. If you'r young and on a budget and just need a place to crash, this place would be fine, but otherwise, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, top location”
Reviews.Author: TheSnakeCharmer
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers have pointed out, this hotel could do with some updates, but it is very well kept and clean, and the staff were friendly. The rooms probably have not been updated (or repainted/papered) since the 80's, but as the design/layout is period style, this is ok. The bathroom is also fine, and the rooms comfortable. I can't comment on the food as we didn't eat breakfast there. The location is excellent - right on a canal (ask for a canal view room), and you can walk to anywhere in the centre easily from there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but dated”
Reviews.Author: Graeme T
Reviews.Content: Central location ideal for exploring Amsterdam, decor and rooms are a little dated

Reviews.Title: “Vintage with great location”
Reviews.Author: Ashutosh1109
Reviews.Content: If you ate one who likes and value vintage, then this hotel will make a good stay. Most positive point about this hotel is a great location. Situated just 2 km from central station and in midst of other tourist attractions of Amsterdam. Do ask for canal side rooms as they offer some splendid view from the balcony. Hotel is quite old so don't expect contemporary and flashy interiors. Breakfast by the side of canal view is worth experiencing. Overall good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Place of contrasts”
Reviews.Author: GustavoMGA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 6 day on new yearÂ´s eve. First, the localization is top notch. Walking distance from all the attractions in the center of the city. Plenty of shops and restaurants on the neighbourhood. The staff is quite kind and helpful, with kudos to our dear Laura, always with the best restaurantÂ´s tips. Thank you, Laura. But yeah, the hotel needs renovation. The instalations are quite old, the room from the last century and the elevator takes a really good time to go up and down. A really good time. Our room on the 5th floor was quite small, with no space to sit besides the bed. But the view was quite nice, overlooking the canals. Breakfast was OK but the restaurant has a nice view of the canal. So yes, I recommend if you dont go with great expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: FIFI339
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doelen in December. The building is lovely overlooking the canal, First impression as you walk through the door was cozy and pretty. The staff were friendly. Our room was a little on the small side and slightly dated, However, it was kept very clean and the bed was comfortable, which, to me, is all that matters. At the end of the day, when you take a city break you spend most of the time out of the hotel walking around. It is in such a fantastic location, easy access to the trams, close to rembrandt plein, about 10 minutes on the tram to Dam square or Leidse plein, so close to the flower market and lots of lovely cafes. I loved my time here, would definately reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hanicka
Reviews.Content: Stayed for several days in August 2011. The hotel is in a great neighborhood, right on one of the canals and within walking distance to a lot of the sights. The building itself has an old school charm, grand staircases and art deco details. The rooms are fairly comfortable ( if somewhat dated) and are clean and have nice views. The staff are friendly and accommodating (well, most Dutch are). There is a small business lounge where wi-fi is free, otherwise you have to pay for an access. Breakfast seemed a bit pricey at 19 euro a pop so we ended up going to Coffee& Co. branch which is right next door ( the doors are interconnected) and that worked really well for us since we only want coffee & piece of pastry for breakfast. There were some drunks outside one night, singing into the morning hours and you could really hear it, the windows are old and don't have much in terms of insulation. But I would probably stay there again, you have a lot of nice shops and restaurants in the neighborhood and it isn't too far from the airport either ( we spent about 40 euro on a taxi from Schiphol) so overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel, worse than a hostels, not safe”
Reviews.Author: Tyww
Reviews.Content: I paid 120 euros on Hotwire it's titled under city centre museum square four star with a 40% rating. What a rip off I might as well been homeless and I'd be better off. You can hear your neighbors using any part of the room and especially the bathroom loudsafety can literally hear them moving around in the bathtub like its on loudspeaker. Not to mention other noises throughout the night. Also experienced a scary situation with the taxi. They refuse to call you a regular taxi and what they call can only be described as mafia like and I had to run for help to the police station and had police escort in the airport.

Reviews.Title: “â€œif you want to experience ams with paying a little more than average.. this is the wrong pickâ€�”
Reviews.Author: zumut
Reviews.Content: Never again... I lived in ams for some time and It was my first time back with me wife and I wanted to pay a little more than usual hostel/2-3 star hotel price and get some decent accommondation so I chose NH doelen. some cons: -They have very limited number of personnel so that when you come to the hotel after midnight you find the main door locked !!! .. That's because the receptionist is touring the floors to make sure everything is OK.. this is an NH hotel but they can't afford having 2 people working a night shift? We had to wait for about 15 minutes out in the cold, with several other people for the receptionist finish his tour and unlock the main enttance -The building is in a bad shape -Our bed was not leveled with broken springs -The staff is obnoxious.. Pros: - good location

Reviews.Title: “A second-rate disappointment”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Doelen many times on business, and it had been getting worse but just about bearable, its convenient central location outweighing its disadvantages. But I recently returned to Amsterdam with my wife and decided to stay at the Doelen again. This time however it has gone too far. Shabby decor and indifferent service makes this hotel not the place it once was. There were some dirty things in our room - we complained and they put it right, but it was like responding to complaints was the norm for them, instead of getting it right first time. The location is good and the canal views are wonderful; if this hotel was renovated it could be one of the best, but for now it is just second-rate. After one night we checked out and went elsewhere. I will not be returning to the Doelen again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and some good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marbella_Mick
Reviews.Content: We booked a Superior Room with canal view and were shown to quite a pokey, tatty room. When I complained to reception they were very understanding and moved us to massive room recently refurbished at the top of the hotel. Marvellous! Just make sure you get a refurbed room and it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, neutral staff”
Reviews.Author: tygrlive
Reviews.Content: We stayed there just overnight... but - rooms are too small, even you get there bad feeling, staff - neutral... they can be probably friendly, but we were comparing them with staff in Dubai (same price level of service - we stopped in AMS in our way back from Dubai) and Dubai is winning! f.E. no body helped us with the lagguage, nobody showed us the rooms etc. Breakfest not bad, but nothing extra. Location luxus! They have a wifi in every room, but they ask extra money for it. Sleeping was bad at all, during summer 2011 is the street under construction and the workers start around 7am.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: GordonFreemanPhD
Reviews.Content: I read some of the other reviews, and became saddened, as that was simply not my experience with the hotel. Upon first glance, you enter a beautiful regal old building set right next to the canal. Marble and wood staircase greet you as you walk to reception. My experience was that the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms lack modern furniture, but are comfortable nonetheless. Breakfasts are delicious and the dining hall looks out right over the canal. A really pleasant stay. Would recommend it any day.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room & rude receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Fifi2011xx
Reviews.Content: My room was absolutely tiny and the bathroom had a very distinctive, unpleasant smell... The TV didn't work, which wouldn't normally bother me. However after spending just under Â£200 per night for the smallesr, most cramped room in Amsterdam, I thought it was a bit much. To top it all off, upon check out I asked the receptionist to book me a taxi to the train station area and you would have thought I had just requested a spaceship! Very rudely, he told me that no taxis were available (without even checking) and told me to walk it instead ( nevermind my heavy suitcase & laptop). After some further probing, he revealed that there was also a suitable tram although he seemed rather reluctant to give this information away! All in all, not a very enjoyable experience and I will not be recommending this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Would not advice anyone to go to any of the NH Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Po87
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights in a single room, the room was too small, and the bed was so tight. I am backpacking oriented, so i didn't feel the luxury of a 4 stars hotel at all. i had troubles to make the reservation happen via email, i had to call them 3 times each call for around 20 minutes. i made the payment via bank transfer only to discover when i got there that they didn't receive the payment although we made the payment on May 5th and we checked in on May 15th, i checked out and checked in again in the NH Schiller, and discovered that they haven't received the money yet . And when i was checking out and asking them about the payment issue, the reception lady told me that they haven't received any money and that they will take the money from my credit card, and suddenly another receptionist over heard us and told me that they had troubles with the finance department and that they received the money but on a different account number which was due to their mistake. i spent my whole trip thinking & worried what the hell am i gonna do about the payment issue due to their horrible bank transfer system and to their horrible hotel and everything. This cannot be a 4 stars hotel, i would rate it 3 and maybe a bit less. and it's very expensive, not worth its value. I admit that it's a historic beautiful place, but that's not good enough. No free Wi-Fi??? this is ridiculouuuus! I wouldn't advice anyone to go to the NH Doelen nor the NH Schiller although they have a greaaaaaaaat location. There are actually plenty of hotels around that have the same good location.

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: iarnox
Reviews.Content: location is fantastic hotel structure reminds to famous hotel rooms smell of old. design and forniture are not in good condition

Reviews.Title: “excelent location, but very old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dilvish5
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel during the Queen's day this year. It has a great location, very close to the Dam, the Flower market and the red lights district. The staff was pretty nice and helpful, and the lobby looked pretty good. However, the rooms are very small and old, with tiny beds and bathroom. I can't say that the beds weren't comfortable, but they were so small that i almost fell few times. The TV in the room was probably older than me, same as the furniture(but that's no problem). The elevator had some big issues, which weren't resolved until i left. The internet is 10Eur/day, which is a bit expensive on a longer stay. The breakfast was around 20 Eur, so i preferred to eat in the city. At nights, it's pretty noisy from the outside, so if you have sleep problems, i really do not recommend this hotel. If you don't care much about the room sizes and furniture, it's a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Service - Wonderful room - great location”
Reviews.Author: LarryHN
Reviews.Content: Room 416 is to kill for - large and nicely appointed with amazing views down a canal. The staff was extremely attentive and took great care of us including ignoring our feeble attempts to pronounce Dutch place and restaurant names and figuring out what we really wanted. They helped us with cabs, restaurant reservations and finding our way around - it was an extremely pleasant experience and stay. And the hotel is no more than a 15 minute walk from any major downtown attraction - museums, churches, great restaurants, attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money, but not great”
Reviews.Author: MarkBarefoot
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews, price and location. To be honest it isn't "the hotel from hell" but it wasn't without its faults. First the good parts! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is ideal for walking to the main bar areas of Amsterdam, and for jumping on a tram for the further place afield. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. Now the not so good.The room we first had was at the front of the hotel, and was on the 3rd floor (room 312). This was a large room and I think they called it a business suite. Had 2 beds put together to make a kingsize - comfy bed. The location unfortunately meant that when trying to sleep you would be interrupted by bikes, cars, people etc going past the cut through road at the front of the hotel. We could also hear the people walking above us on the 4th floor, and outside. It's an old hotel so I suppose this comes with the territory. To top it all, the hotel was robbed in the early hours of the Saturday morning - 2 men follwed someone in, and while the night watchman was on the 4th floor they jumped the reception. The first we heard was when the police were breaking down the nightdoor! It was the 2nd time this happened too, we were later informed. After asking the frontdesk to move rooms to the rear of the hotel, next to the canal, they did so without fuss so if you do stay I would recommend asking for a canalside room - much quiter. Couple more minor things; really slow lift, I mean really slow, and the showers were weak.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: napagels
Reviews.Content: Classy reception area sets the bar a bit high, as the rooms were pretty basic and plain but everything was clean and in good working order. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Slowest elevator I have ever seen, and free wifi would have been nice, considering the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: daveyC32
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Doelen a couple of times in the past. The last time was about 10 years ago. We decided to stay there again and were looking forward to the hotel that we remembered. Sadly, it has gone downhill somewhat since out last visit. The staff were still very efficient and friendly, and the location is excellent. But I think the hotel needs work to bring it back into the 4 star caregory. The room was very small... Nowhere to put you things other than on the floor. The bathroom was shabby and the TV didn't work properly. The main problem was the noise. When we first went into the room I thought the window had been left open. However, it was just the tired, worn out double glazing. It was so noisy at night we had to phone down for earplugs! We could also hear every word of the people in the next room. Very poor when compared to similar 4 star hotels in Amsterdam. We won't stay at the Doelen again.

Reviews.Title: “great location on the canal on renovated pedestrain street”
Reviews.Author: lareiss
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well kept with pleasant staff - near major shopping streets and museums. 5 minute walk to Dam Square. Love the coffee shop connected to the hotel overlooking the canal. Will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Do stay in the Doelen... a great spot in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Hanzibar
Reviews.Content: The NH Doelen was ideally located for a short break, a short walk from the flower market, Dam square and Rembrandt square. To your left is a Coffee shop and to your right an open Wine Bar/restaurant, just across the canal are a selection of restaurants and bars. I travelled alone and felt safe and comfortable here, the hotel looks good inside and out. I arrived at the hotel early by shuttle bus although if I had taken the train it would have been fairly simple to navigate from the station. The lobby was small but elegant and grand with a few steps to get to the desk. Nobody was there to help me with my bag but I managed it. They only had a smoking room available at that time which I didnâ€™t want so I Ieft my luggage locked behind the reception desk and checked in after 3pm. The lady at reception was great, really helpful, gave me a booklet about Amsterdam, lots of leaflets about excursions and a map that I saw on sale for 2euros, which she marked out the main attractions on. I booked a single room so I was pleased to find a double bed and a good sized room and bathroom, it was fairly good value considering Amsterdam is expensive for hotels. The TV had BBC1 and there was a Kettle and Tea & Coffee and a tempting mini-bar, but 7.50 euros for a mini bottle of Wine so I restrained myself. My room faced the Canal on the top floor with a pretty view, the walls/windows were thin so there was some noise at night. Iâ€™m a heavy sleeper so it didnâ€™t bother me but some people would find it annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but location is the curse”
Reviews.Author: marygeralyn
Reviews.Content: Pros: Hotel is beautiful. Service is fantastic. Rooms were extremely large, and the bathroom even had a beautiful tub. Way pricier than we'd normally pay, but it was worth it. Cons: It's phenomenal location is its own curse. Being in the center of the "action" (bars, restaurants, canal), leads to people screaming outside your window all night. No matter how great the insulation is, we were still woken up by the screaming. If that's your cup of tea, go for it. Otherwise, head to Plantage (the area by the zoo) where it is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “History No Mystery”
Reviews.Author: Herr55Pdog
Reviews.Content: Stayed (with small dog) for 125 euro in a big room, huge by many central Ansterdam standards. If you want state of the art, look elsewhere, but the tab will likely be much higher without much more comfort. The furnishings and decor are definitely from another era, but that works in many charming ways at NH Doelen. The updated bathroom looked recently remodeled. The staff was excellent and accomodating at all hours. If you have a couple days to get familiar with the area's winding canal streets you'll find relatively easy walking distance to anywhere around central Amsterdam, and interesting streets any direction. Almost next door to opera house. Small TV but many, multi-language channels 3 or 4 which are English 24 hours, including CNN and BBC. It was approximately -6 centigrade, and the heaters were pretty outdated, so that could be a problem for someone with specific temperature concerns. You could hear some rowdy folks down on the street from our windows, but if somebody's got a problem with people partying, they might want to rethink the destination. Besides the obvious tourist distractions, Amsterdam has an interesting past that still serves as a foundation for the current bohemian beehive, and NH Doelen still felt like a vibrant part of the scene. With age has come a funky cool. There is a small historical marker indicating that this is where Rembrandt painted The Night Watch. The under renovation Rijksmuseum Museum still has lines around the block, with that masterpiece as the central attraction. The exhibit's basic guide listings serve as a pretty comprehensive guide to Amsterdam's history and you'll get feel for tradition, not tourism. If you stop at a decent coffee shop, the line for the museum ( 3/4 to one hour) isn't bad at all. NH Doelen is relatively close to most major venues, around a 15 minute walk to Paradiso, Hard Rock/comedy club area, and crowded restaurant and smokeshop squares. Numerous public transportation points near hotel, but this is a unique place to walk, despite often uneven cobblestones on narrow streets you will probably have to dodge a few bikes on. Well worth it, and in terms of people watching alone NH Doelen has some great views both on property and nearby. Anyone visiting Amsterdam by car for the first time should definitely make verifiable advance parking plans (don't count on suburb park and ride stations) or be prepared to pay approximately 50 euro per 24 hour parking almost anywhere within reasonable walking distance of noteworthy areas. And good luck without a GPS, many of which seem to become intoxicated by construction and narrow one way half streets anyway. NH Doelen had excellent valet service at 45$ a day, well worth it considering the street area immediately in front of NH Doelen will probably be a construction zone for a while and thus a real pain to drive. The dog acted normal/happy, room came with small bed/basket and fetch toy that was used often. This was a very good stay at a well run hotel, an assessment agreed by all parties in a three room/floor group.

Reviews.Title: “A sparkling canal-side gem near the heart of a vibrant city”
Reviews.Author: mainemountainbear
Reviews.Content: Front desk service was generally excellent throughout our stay, including taking special care to arrange reliable taxis for guests. Our room was clean and small, yet not cramped. Amenities included free WiFi in hotel foyer, in-room flatscreen cable TV, and a mini-bar. Hotel is a reasonable walk to major in-city tourist attractions, but far enough away to remain quiet and cozy. We most liked the hotel's location. We least liked its unexpected city-imposed room surcharges upon checking out.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T stay here if you value your sleep”
Reviews.Author: NealBrighton
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review as I lie awake listening to every word said in the next room. Reception are charming but say this is the oldest hotel in Amsterdam and there is nothing to do; they "cannot build me a new hotel". All I expect as a business traveller is sleep - though some other criticisms are: no restaurant no blackout no gym, sauna, spa - no nothing! small cold room with very tired decor Great view though!

Reviews.Title: “Location is the key - good and bad”
Reviews.Author: anxi0us_traveler
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at NH Doelen, spending a Sat-Sun in Amsterdam before traveling again on Monday for work. I arrived at the hotel around 9am after an overnight flight, and was not able to check into my room - but I have found that this occurs more often than not travelling in Europe. I was able to leave my bags at the hotel and was requested to come back after 12:00pm. Bag check is semi-secure, they are stored behind the check-in desk, but still out in the open, so I would take anything important with me. As for the location, it was easy walking distant to popular attractions; a little over a mile to Anne-Frank Haus and Rijk/Van Gogh Musuem in the opposite dircection. Also, easliy accesbile to Daam Square. Depending on the amount of luggage it is also not a terrible walk from Centraal Station, less than a mile, (1.2 km). After sight seeing in the morning I was getting tired and went back to the hotel around 1:30pm. My room was ready and I as able to take a nap. My room was clean, although outdated. Bathroom was also clean, I felt comfortable taking a bath and shower. I could not figure out the TV but I did not plan to watch any television anyway. During the afternoon, the room was quiet enough for a nap, but the street noise was very loud on saturday evening, even with the windows closed. I needed to use earplugs to blockout the revelry at the bars below. I feel that in this case the location is a positive and a negative. There are a lot of bars/pubs and retaurants across the canal from the hotel, which is useful if you are looking to just stumble back to the hotel, but can be annoying if you are trying to sleep - the noise from the bars bouces off the buldings and the canals back towards the hotel. I paid 160EU (~$220), and this may have been a bit much for an outdated hotel, but it was comperable to other hotels near attractions I wanted to visit. I did not eat breakfast at the hotel. There were plenty of returants serving breakfast after 9:30a within walking distance of the hotel. See my other reviews on where I ate.

Reviews.Title: “They only get better than this - the TRUE FAWLTY TOWERS”
Reviews.Author: BayTreckers
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is so bad that after seeing our photos even our travel agent has pulled it from sale and advised wholesalers to do the same. Go there if you are curious but don't say I didn't warn you!!! The first "room" was a 3 part room with "views" over roof tops past a a rotted window sill. The room was airless, tiny and hot. We saw in the elevator "upgrade your room" so this must be a first room you get then they sting you for 30, 50 or 80 euros extra per night to upgrade. We upgradaed to the extra 50 euro per night room (after having paid a premium price for what appeared to be a nice hotel online). The room still had threadbear carpet, lots of flies, fittings coming off the walls, one side of the bed had a board under it for support - the other side should have been condemned about 30 years ago! The stains under the matress were puzzling and horific. Go there and find out for yourself. Don't forget to count the flies on the breakfast offering in the morning..... Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Dump of a hotel in downtown Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: Eric F
Reviews.Content: Abject dump of a hotel, complete with worn out everything, spiders, dirty walls and decor ready to be bulldozed. A horror among the NH chain, which is usually fine. This place enjoys a good location though desperately needs renovation on every floor. Staff seems blind to dirty curtains, floors, walls, and spiders climbing about. Amenities are almost non-existent and it was a wonder that the sheets were clean. Avoid this in favor of almost anything else.

Reviews.Title: “On the whole very good, but with reservations”
Reviews.Author: AmandaDorset
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. We were warmly welcomed by the reception staff and first impressions were good. However, the room we had been given (208) was a disappointment to us. It was extremely clean but rather shabby and worn. The net curtain was grey and torn, the tv unit was badly scratched and the walls and paintwork showed signs of wear. The bathroom was a bit odd too - I, at 5 ft 7 ins couldn't reach the taps of the bath without getting in the bath and it made having a shower very tricky. This was also a very noisy room with the noise from the street below. On our second day we asked to change and were given a lovely room, in much better decorative order, and with a lovely canal view. The staff were great, friendly and professional. The breakfasts were wonderful and it was lovely to look out of the window of the restaurant onto the canal. All in all a great hotel, to which I would return, as long as it wasn't to room 208!

Reviews.Title: “Lucky outcome with a last minute city break”
Reviews.Author: red600man
Reviews.Content: An above average hotel with excellent service in an ideal location, easy walking distance of all main tourist attractions, Staff pleasant and friendly. Strongly recommend you secure a room reservation overlooking the canal. All other rooms face a very busy through road which means that you can be woken by passing vehicles, delivery vehicles and hotel refuse collection vehicle from as early as 7.00 am each day. Evening/early morning traffic doesn't subside on averge until 02.30 am. (Mosquito spray a must).

Reviews.Title: “lovely old hotel”
Reviews.Author: pam49bellevue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our 4 weeks in Europe. It's a wonderfully old hotel (17th century?)--I believe it's the oldest in Amsterdam. We had been told that it had A/C by the NH Hotel central booking agency but found it didn't--when they learned that we had been given incorrect info, they upgraded us to a junior suite which was really huge with great canal views, etc.--so it was fine. It has the character of a very old building (and the creaks), but we've found NH Hotels to be of good quality everywhere we went and this was no exception. Excellent location to walk to most everything you want to see. The staff was very knowledgeable and extremely helpful every time we went to the desk. In 4 weeks around Europe, this was the first time we'd been given a packet of tourist info, things to see, etc.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sildeiver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with my wife, and had a wonderful time. The hotel is situated in walking distance to almost everything within the city centre, and there are a lot of nice cafÃ©s and restaurants nearby. Loved the Coffee Company at the ground floor of the hotel, with comfy chairs, a nice atmosphere (the University of Amsterdam is just around the corner) and a lovely canal view. Booked a junior suite on the 3rd floor, and got a rather smallish and old but cosy room, with a fantastic view of the Kloveniersburgwal canal and the Zuiderkerk. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel, as there are lots of nice places nearby. Two breakfast favourites are the Cafe de Jaren next door, and La Place at the nearest end of Kalverstraat 200 meters away. Lovely and helpful staff too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: halfpint6799
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the NH Doelen. Nothing wrong with the room, clean, not large but not to small, I have stayed in alot smaller in Europe therefore no complaints on the room size. Don't come to Europe and expect the same room size's as in the US you will be greatly dissappointed. No air conditioning either and that is also typical for Europe. I haven't stayed in a place in Europe yet that has air conditioning. Just open the window and all is good. Staff was excellent, courteous, friendly and very helpful. The only problem I had was the trash collectors in the morning dumping the hundreds of glass bottles into their truck but hey, it has to be done. I didn't hear people leaving the bars at 4 in the morning like other reviews but I probably wasn't there at the busiest time of the year either. Location was excellent close to everything, a short walk to the flower market, waterlooplein (flea market), trams etc.. Only ate in their resturant once as they gave us a free breakfast while waiting for our room to be ready. Internet is not free, they give you 30 minutes but that's it. It was like 5 euro's for 1 hour or 10.70 euro's for 24 hours. I would definately stay here again and can't wait to return to Amsterdam again and the NH Doelen.

Reviews.Title: “Been Back again, I believe you all now, brutal hotel”
Reviews.Author: A140
Reviews.Content: Well i have stayed here before and love the location but I had read some really bad reviews of thehotel before hand so i decided to give it a go and see if you are all right in what you have said on these pages, you are. The hotel has no aircon, I'm Irish dont have air con in our houses but hotel rooms that's shocking, the room was so hot and no window toopen because we had a shared balcony, couldn't sleep at all. Noise level inside the hotel was mental, the fire escape was near our room and we could hear the door slamming all night , no sleep again. Upon reserving my room I informed the staff that I am a smoker and would need a room with a balcony, to smoke. Second day there I was locked out of the room by the cleaner and had to report to reception to be told off by the staff for smoking on the balcony, I was very annoyed, I had sat shivering on the balcony the night before with the door held closed with a piece of card as the door had no lock on it.....terrible hotel. I have stayed next door in the hotel d'leurope and you would be much better of they have a great hotel there and understand the importance of repeat business. My husband and I travel a lot to holland and we use the NH hotel chain sometimes but I would never recommend this hotel as it's not good value for money , much better hotels in the area for similiar price. Believe what you read on these pages, I went back to check and it's true, stay somewhere else Krasnapolsky is a better NH hotel on Dam sq. Big balconies too

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: Testedtraveller
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a super location. Ideal for sightseeing - Dam Square short walk away. All other "must see" places within walking distance - Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh museum, Anne Frank Huis, Rembrandthuis, etc. Good restaurant nearby for tasty light meals - De Jaren Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: bibiking1th
Reviews.Content: NH Doelen Hotel is housed in a beautiful old building but it is not only impressive from the outside but from the inside too. I liked our room- it had an antique kind of design and was equipped with everything one could possibly think of, including a work desk with an internet access. We booked it mainly because of its central location but once we arrived at the hotel we realized we were much luckier than we thought we were, as the central location was not its only advantage. It was really very pleasant staying there. There are cheaper hotels in Amsterdam but this one was so lovely I'm happy we paid a bit more!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: helbourne
Reviews.Content: We booked this via hotels.nl - we had no idea which one of 7 NH hotels we would end up in! Needless to say we were sooooo happy with their choice for us! The hotel is beautiful inside and out, the staff were so friendly & more than happy to help & advise! The beds were comfy & you get a choice of 4 pillows (on request) There was some outside noise, but it is Amsterdam! We will definitely be going back this time next year - but not leaving it to chance and booking direct! This is a gem of a hotel in a wonderful city! Its ideally placed & within walking distance of many attractions

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!”
Reviews.Author: bristol-blondie86
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner have just stayed at this hotel for 3 nights from the 29th January. Its only a 5 minute taxi ride from central station and close to the tram lines. Check in went well but didnt tell us when breakfast would be served and where as we were staying room only. I found one of the those order forms from room service breakfast and nealy had a fit when I saw the price. 19 euro's pp plus a 4 euro tray charge for full breakfast delievered to your room. Its worth the short walk to the local bakery and get breakfast. I made the booking for the room with last minute.com and paid Â£212 for 3 nights on room only basis. I booked i through one of thier top secret hotel deals. But was dissapointed when I read some of the reviews. I wouldnt trust all of them. I would defently stay at this hotel if I could get the right deal again. Lovely looking hotel and very 5* looking in the reception area. You have to pay 30 euros extra for a canal view room which also includes a mini bar. I wasnt willing to pay that much extra. We were allocated room 204 which was on the canal side of the hotel!! So I was happy about that. The rooms on the same side as ours, the next one down had balconys which looked lovely. So if its a special occasion I think its worth the money for the upgrade. The room was off a good size, very comfy double bed. Large wardrobe with plenty of hanging space and trouser press. There was also a safe within the wardrobe for special items, didnt bother with that and hoped the staff were trustworthy!! Which they were thank god.The bathroom had a bath with a shower over it. The ONLY problem I had during our stay was with the plug in the bath. The chain was attached to the plug hole so wouldnt let you twist the plug down into the hole. Went to reception and reported the problem. 5 minutes later I had maintenance at the door who I though had fixed the problem. When he left I started to run a bath but the plug would still not sit in the hole with a tight lock. So couldnt have a proper bath without keeping the water running. Great for temperature but not eco friendly!! That problem would seem trivial to some people but when you pay for a service, it should work!! But I couldnt be bothered to change rooms just in case we had a non canal view room. Another bonus for the fussy pillow types- they have a pillow menu!!! 5 different types of pillows to choosed from for every type you could need. I thought that was a nice touch as I always miss my pillows from home. The hotel location was perfect and was about 5 minute walk to Dam sqaure, the dungeons and 10 mins to Madame Tussuards. I would recommend booking most trips in advance. I paid 18.50 for the dungeons.But if you go on the tussards website you can get a better deal. The red light district and Anne Frank house were 10 minute walk away which is good for when you are sight seeing. Most resturants locally do some great deals on food also. 11 euros for steak, chips and salad which is a bargain. Overall I would most defently visit this hotel. I have worked within 4 and 5 star hotels so I am most picker than the average person. They could do little things like update the wall paper etc but its not dirty!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed at best”
Reviews.Author: fearmÃ³r
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times and I guess I'll do so again, but it realy does need a lick of paint. the location is good, everybody is friendly and the connecting coffee shop adds a bit of character. However, its not cheap and the rooms realy need to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gloucestergirl
Reviews.Content: As others have said the lobby is pleasant and the staff very helpful, and that is where the good stuff ends. The rooms are very tired looking, ripped wallpaper and very small. The bathrooms are desperate for an update and so once beyond the lovely decor of the lobby it is a disappointment awaiting you. Lovely location, but yet again, noisy. You could find better and for much less money. We paid Â£200 a night including breakfast and that was indeed a huge rip off !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdaman
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed my 12th stay at the Doelen Hotel; as always the staff made me feel like a KING. I look forward to my next visit there. Tom Landis

Reviews.Title: “Expected nice but got a tired room and noise outside”
Reviews.Author: lizm_60
Reviews.Content: The building exterior is beautiful. The lobby is nice. The room we got was tired, clean but not feeling very clean, tiny, and very disappointing. The BBC World channel that was listed as channel 2 was actually Animal Planet. The internet wasn't free. The buffet breakfast was nice enough so we were pleased with that. The location was good for exploring but even though we faced a canal, there was a fair amount of night noise (it was a friday night and our window was open, to be fair). The staff was quite pleasant and helpful for tourist type things. Overall, though, not what I had hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - nice old style, good location”
Reviews.Author: spletzi
Reviews.Content: Having been to some Amsterdam hotels already for business reasons, this made it into my Top3 I would recommend for leisure purposes (behind Toren and Vondel). Having been there for less than 12 hours, I was impressed by the "old-fashioned" style which I have not found yet in inner city, really nice. Was lucky and had a small, but nicely decorated room with Canal view (room 306). Windows can be opened (which is not common in A'dam). Big wardrobe, with ironing facility and water boiler. Enough space for working. Did no have breakfast. 200m to tram station, close to Flower market. Would choose it again if canal view provided.

Reviews.Title: “No reason to choose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gunnar2000
Reviews.Content: There is no good reason to choose this hotel for your stay in Amsterdam. It is not a bad place, there are just so many better for better value. You will leave feeling slightly ripped off, and in my opinion you will be slightly ripped off. You know when you buy a pair of shoes on sale for 60 euro, and the salesman says you've made a bargain because full price at his store is 80. You feel ok. And the next day you pass a shop that sells the exact same shoes at full price for 50 - and in your favourite color. You know the feeling? That is what staying at Hotel Doelen feels like. It is rated as a four-star, and was in no way as good as the three-star we left in Germany. The paint coming off just next to the cobweb (!) at the entrance was tell-tale, and should have warned of things like the shower just barely making a trickle of water. Hotel-advise for Amsterdam: Get your room as high as possible from the street noise. The bars are best in the next street. Avoid tram-lines close to your room, they are effective transport but the noise and shaking of buildings makes them better to go in the next street. Stay out of most central city-area, where there will be parties, small rooms and big bills. It is so incredibly easy and nice to stroll a couple of thousand metres away from the bar scene when you've had enough but the others want to keep going. We got a decent, newly furnished room at Doelen and paid an additional 30 euro a night for canal-view. We were not so much interested in the view, as we wanted to avoid the insane noise from the street. True - the noise in Niueew Doelenstraat is not the worst. The room was dusty, and there were curly hairs in various colors on the woolen badspread. We tossed the bedspread on the big cupboard. The room in it self was not bad exept for the before-mentioned barely leaking shower. Apparently - we were lucky still. One night we came to the hotel, it was impossible to get service in the desk because the only staff working was busy with a client that said he had been charged to much on his credit card. Apparently that was not his only complaint. Last thing I heard him say before the slow elevator closed us in, was "nothing works in my room! The shower, the telephone..." Shortly we also had a credit-card experience. We planned for a bill at around 400 euros. The hotel reserved 480 euros on my account from day one, and said nothing. That means you can't use those money, no matter if your plan is to pay by cash or travellers cheques at the point of leaving. I understand the hotel need security, but they should have told us in stead of just locking it on my account. Service at the hotel varied greatly. The daytime staff was great. The nighttime staff nice but weird and not so professional. One did not know the services the hotel boasts of in the wlecome brochure, and snapped at me on the phone. Another sent me way downtown for a snack when there were plenty possiblilites 100 meters away in the other direction. He simply did not know he area around the hotel. Luckily, some guy I met on the street knew better.

Reviews.Title: “beware”
Reviews.Author: springbutterfly
Reviews.Content: made a reservation. had to cancel approx. two weeks in advance. found out same day i was able to go afterall, so i remade my reservation. they informed me there were no rooms available, let alone my junior suite. i should use one of their sister hotels, which i did. the doelen charged me full price for the junior suite i never saw. turned uin iver ti mastercard, there was nothing they could do. the doelen sent the explanation-in dutch.

Reviews.Title: “very nice week end”
Reviews.Author: LOLANetherlands
Reviews.Content: we had a very good time at the NH Doelen. The location is fantastic,very close to the DAM,the rooms are spacious and clean, we had a room with view on the canal and a little balcony which was lovely. The staff is attentive and helpful,they offer a late check out option on Sundays which we benefited from. We paid 120 euros for the room which is very very very reasonable regarding the surrounding dumps who will charge you 80 quids just for you to get beg bugs and bitten by roaches. There is a nice little coffee place attached to the hotel. I always liked the NH chain and I will definitely use it again!

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Experience”
Reviews.Author: BillaBarber
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the Tourist Information centre in front of the Amsterdam Rail station as we had travelled from Belgium by rail. The outer apperance and Reception was quite freindly and we moved to the city after depositing our luggage. We took care of putting valuables in the safe provided by the Hotel. The expereince in the city was quite pleasant and we moved all over by local Trams. The hotel rooms are very small but functional. The amenties included hot baths attached to rooms and Tea/Coffe Maker is also available. The location is very near to the house of Rembrandt. We had a bad experince on the last day as we had checked out and deposited our luggage with hotel which they kept in luggage room. Wewere given baggage tags for reclaims. When we returned after couple of hours, we found that our bag containing laptop was removed from the room. The hotel staff expressed their complete helpness in tracing it and we were left with one dud baggage tag holding in our hands!! We lost a lot but hotel did not compensate it. Be care in these kind of hotels!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Fisherman'swife
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent Easter weekend in Amsterdam at the Doelen and chose it based on the location being central to museums, shopping, and nightlife. Sometimes we would pop back in to change our clothes for our next adventure. The hotel is in a historic building on a canal; the room size is actually larger than we are used to in Europe. The furniture is a little tired but comfortable and the service was very good. Our only issue was that to keep the room cool at night (we enjoyed unusually warm weather) we had to keep the windows open and it was quite noisy at 4 in the morning when the bars closed. A special treat was the canalside cafe next door where we enjoyed a glass of wine in the afternoon sun!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Cunningham8
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a trip to Amsterdam and booked this hotel through the Trip Advisor website. I found the staff in the hotel polite, very friendly and accommodating, nothing seemed too much. When we got to our room we found out that we had been upgraded to a canal room on the fourth floor which was a wonderful bonus with great views. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as it seemed expensive, the result of a bad rate of the Â£ to the Euro. The room was clean and comfortable, certainly not luxury but adequate for the amount of time we stayed there. Overall we enjoyed our stay in the hotel and were pleasantly surprised. It was in a great location with all the sights easily accessible by foot or for the less active the trams and canal boats were near at hand. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Check the bedsheets!”
Reviews.Author: NorwichBex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Doelen for 3 nights over Valentines Weekend. We booked through Travel Republic and got a really good deal including breakfast which worked out a lot cheaper than all the other websites I checked (Â£240 total). I had requested a room with canal view if possible and was extremely surprised that we got one (see photo) considering the hotel was fully booked and such a room cost 30 Euros a night upgrade. When we arrived the receptionist was friendly and took our bags as the room wasn't available. Later when we got into the room, I checked the bedsheets and found some spots of blood on one of the sheets. I phoned down to reception to get them changed, shortly after a man came in and wanted to check the sheets first. I pointed out the stains and he disputed it was blood and laughed. I said it was and I wanted the sheets changed, reluctantly he took the sheet off and to our horror the mattress protector under the sheet was covered in a large red stain and large brown stain and other smaller stains. I actually felt sick at the sight of it! I said that he could take that sheet away too, and he replied he couldn't take it off! He was totally non-plussed about it! I insisted and so he did remove it (muttering in his language under his breath) and put back a plain sheet on the bed. No apology - just made me feel like a real inconvenience. The room itself had seen better days, the wooden furniture was chipped, the chair and bottom of the bed grubby and stained, the wallpaper was peeling off the walls and the bathroom had some cracked tiles and smelt strongly of urine whenever you took a shower. Breakfast was excellent and we managed to get a table looking out onto the canal each morning which was lovely. When we checked out the receptionist asked how our stay had been and I mentioned about the sheets to which he replied sorry to hear that but it was clear he was just asking becuase he had to and didn't mean the aplogy. Also when we checked in he had said that he needed a credit card for the room but as we only had a debit card he said he would have to take 50 Euros and would give us this back in cash when we checked out. He asked whether there was anything else he could do and I asked for the 50 Euros (clearly he had forgotten about it, he had to go and check with a colleague but I'm sure if I hadn't have asked we would have lost out on our 50 Euros!) If you're not too fussed on cleanliness or well-cared for rooms then book the Doelen - it is a great location and breakfast is delicious but I'm afraid that's about all there is going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: MashaB
Reviews.Content: Though we arrived to the hotel 4 hours before the check-in, we were not only given a room, but also had a free upgrade to a suite with a view to channel and Niewe Markt. The personnel at the reception was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very rich, tasty and as it was Sunday was served till 12 a.m. The room was equiped with everything you may need while travelling, there were also a range of cosmetics specially for women. Great location - all sights are in walking distance. Will absolutely return there!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: tandcookie
Reviews.Content: I booked the travel package through NWA. The room was a little small, but charming with a great view. The buffet breakfast was fabulous and something to look forward to every day. The staff was warm, friendly and helpful. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “nice!”
Reviews.Author: mulan85
Reviews.Content: i stayed here, last year, i'd been meaning to write a review because i had such a great time here. The hotel from the outside isnt the most spectacular, inside it's standard looking with an old feel to it, not ugly at all, it worked. when we arrived, the staff were extremely nice, so helpful and always smiling. they even upgraded us to a canal view room which had amazing views, it definitely made our stay better. the breakfast buffet was delicious, a variety of breads, croissants, cheese, meats, bacon, eggs, sausages, marvelous! it was so tastey i made my boyfriend wake up early to eat with me! (he hates waking up early!) the room was clean, if not a little bit dusty and on the small side, but its perfect for two really considering you're only there to sleep. the bathroom was clean, they provide a few products which was nice. overall it was pleasant, the staff wonderfull and helpful and great food! will definitely come here again next time im in amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Got Ripped Off”
Reviews.Author: BoatBaron
Reviews.Content: Our plans changed, so we tried to change our internet reservation and we're told we'd be charged for one night as a cancellation charge, even though it was 3 weeks before the arrival date. We e-mailed back and forth over this, pointing out there was no such notice on the internet site and the reservation, although confusingly worded said, "If you should cancel your reservation before 6:PM of your arrival day, you will not be charged any feesâ€� They were adamant and charged our credit card $222 for the cancellation. Now we're fighting through the Credit Card. My advice is be very careful with the NH Hotel chain and their policies and make sure your reservation is cancellable without penalty.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: PassionateTraveler66
Reviews.Content: We switched to this hotel "on the fly" while we were already in Amsterdam and disappointed with the nearby hotel we booked from home. We spotted the fascinating building and were attracted to the baroque, impressive lobby. We may have reconsidered our booking if we would have seen the room first. We went for the upgraded, canal view room. We also bought the package that includes the buffet breakfast which is excellent. The first room that was assigned to us at fifth floor made us turn around and ask for a different one. Not only that it was unacceptably small but also had small, cheap looking sliding windows. The second room was still quite worn out and in dire need of a facelift but at least had the old world flavour and class we desired. The bathroom was really basic and the shower malfunctioning and was not fixed throughout our stay. To the good parts. The hotel itself is beautiful and the dining hall above the canal is just perfect. Breakfast itself is well presented and tasty. The location is ideal away from main street tumult but still central. The front desk staff was absolutely fabulous! Throughout my many years in hotels all over the world I never run into a team so friendly and helpful. It was a pleasure. I think that the rooms' condition is known to the administration and well reflected in the relatively affordable fare. For this reason I consider that despite the drawbacks, the value for the money is good indeed. Overall we had a pleasant experience and would return to this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: whosallen
Reviews.Content: NH Doelen is a quaint hotel located near Amsterdam University in City Centre. Everything was within walking distance of the hotel. The rooms were small but clean and comfortable. The Hotel staff was extremely helpful with directions, what to see in the immdediate area and general information. We did not use the on site restaurant as it appeared rather pricey. There was considerable night noise with the windows open on the street side of the hotel. The canal view rooms might be wuiter, though more costly. We did get a very favorable, week-end rate below the average cost of many lower rated hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: clairelybelgian
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend spent at the Doelen, it's ideally located to walk to the Centraal station in 10 mins, or most places in the centre of town in a short time. Plenty of tram connections nearby, so could not fault it for visiting all the sights. Cons: Could be noisy from the street Small room, very difficult to move around the bed, table and chairs were in the way of the bathroom door No shower curtain for the in bath shower, resulted in slippery floor. Hotel breakfast not worth 17 euros- avoid! Bed could be bigger, but not in those rooms! Pros: Clean bathroom Sheets & towels replaced daily, despite other reviews Helpful reception staff who changed a room to a twin for us with no fuss at all Breakfast overlooking canal Coffee chain (not coffeeshop) downstairs I admit that the decor is a little tired looking and could use an update, but as long as you get a good price, the location is central and all you're doing there is sleeping so why worry! The canal rooms have a nice view of the Amstel, but beware the shared balcony with sudden drop! Be prepared for small rooms in Amsterdam everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms could do with some TLC (tender loving care)”
Reviews.Author: Northern_lassy
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a recent weekend stay at this hotel. I had read the previous reviews but wanted to give it a try. First impressions on entering the reception area was wow, this looks lovely and looked very elegant. They had obviously spent money on the reception area and this made us look forward to seeing our rooms (there were four of us). Upon entering the room (twin 3rd Floor) we thought it was bright but the decor was very tired and could do with painting/touching up. I understand that they may want to keep the hotel's original features as it is definately not a modern hotel as the furniture looked tatty/cheap and I'm sure it would benefit from even better quality reproduction furniture. The bathroom didnt seem to match the room and we had a shower over the bath with no shower curtain, so of course water went everywhere. We mentioned this to reception did send someone up who told us that some bathrooms were not meant to have a shower curtain (which we thought was odd as there was a shower, so why no curtain?). We ended up using towels on the floor to mop up the water. I had read in previous reviews that some guests experienced noise and we did too at night time (our room was overlooking the canal) but I guess you can't control noise from the outside. On the last night there was also a sound like a loud humming noise but we couldn't quite work out where it was coming from. Whoever was meant to service our room during our stay on the 3rd floor didnt replace/fill any of the toiletries so we at one point had no hand soap and ran out of toilet roll. We also had to ask for more tea/milk as this wasnt restocked either. Having to ask repeatedly for things to be restocked/replaced for a four star hotel isnt acceptable. I think management should at least ensure that when things are running low in guest rooms they are replaced so guests dont have to keep asking for things - it just makes for a more relaxing stay. Upon returning to our room one day we saw one of the housekeeping ladies sat on the end of a bed in another room at the end of the corridor (the door was open) and as soon as she saw us she jumped up. This just made us wonder if they actually did any cleaning to our rooms at all whilst we are out. The other 2 in our party had a twin room on the 5th floor which was very small and warm (a fan was already provided). On the whole, Amsterdam was great, the location itself was great but I would not stay at this particular hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “liked de doelen”
Reviews.Author: joop1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for business and liked the hotel. The room was nice and overlooking the Amstel river. A bit old fashioned furniture and decoration, but that has its charm. Service is good and friendly. Better value for money for me than their five star-neighboor.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Bar Check”
Reviews.Author: lafawnda
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location, within walking distance to most places and the area also felt safe. The room was just meeting ok, could have done with new carpets and a good clean. Most annoyingly was the early morning knock on the door for ' mini bar check'. Even with a do not disturb on the door. We stayed for 4 days and it happened every morning, could this not be checked by housekeeping when we had left the room for the day? or after our 4 days, they had our credit card details. Good points about this hotel is its location, also it's worth asking for a room with a canal view . Bad Points- Cafe, disturbance and facilities

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: bakalawah
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our two kids in June, 2007 last Summer. I really liked the location being near Muntplein. It is a good location from which to walk in different directions and explore. We walked to Rembrandtplein and also up Kalverstradt to Dam Square, etc. I did not like the Central Station area. I like to walk and walk but my kids' legs got tired so we couldn't walk and explore Amsterdam as much as I would've liked to. We also liked the food area in Vroom and Dreesman (V&D) Dept. store and the Hema store which are only a few mins. walk from the Doelen on Kalverstradt. The manager Monika (if I remember correctly) was very helpful and friendly. Yes, there was some dust under the bed, but overall the hotel was very nice. The hot water was too hot and the bathroom floor slippery when wet but no other problems. (The water was too hot also in the Ibis Amsterdam airport hotel). I think our room was room 510 ,looking northwest; we could see Dam Square and its blue flags from our balcony. I would stay at the Doelen again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Doelen”
Reviews.Author: janex
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at the NH Doelen and to be honest after reading some of the reviews we were quite relieved to find it was actually ok. The room was clean, not too small,with all the usual bits, minibar tv, hairdrier, toiletries,safe. The bath had seen better days, and it helped if you had an athletic bent as it wasnt the easiest to get in and out of!( A bit of mould and mildew spray round the tiles wouldnt have gone amiss either), but it was a decent size and at least it did have a bath rather than just a shower. Clean towels daily. We had a 'ladies room' which had extra toiletries and new magazines, nicely decorated , maybe a little tired. round the edges The reception staff were all very pleasant. The location is great, and the area is lovely and close to just about everything,We would stay there again. The canal facing rooms are an extra 30euro. We would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: likes2roam
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our week's stay at the NH Doelen. It was a great location in the heart of Amsterdam and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. Breakfast was enjoyable and the rooms were small, but clean! I really enjoyed their line of bath products---good smelling body wash!

Reviews.Title: “V Good if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: Patrick44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, has good front of house staff, small rooms with big beds, interesting furniture, good bathrooms, and some good restaurants closeby. I found no problems with cleanliness. The bathroom in room 210 was bright and spotless but access to and from the bath/shower was awkward and would not suit an elderly person. I've stayed before and will again if I get a good price through Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great, if you can get a deal!”
Reviews.Author: rstonesuga
Reviews.Content: Booked through lastminute.com, had the basic 2 person room for 90 euro on a wednesday night. I believe we had room 208. Very nice hotel, antique looking furniture everywhere, very elegant, oldest hotel in amsterdam we were told. Elevator small and slow but entirely functional. Everything was clean, which is my number one priority, and I had no complaints there, would have happily laid down on the floor upon arrival. Very comfortable beds after staying in a hostel for 3 nights. They have a pillow menu supposedly but we did not enquire, as we were happy with what was on the bed when we arrived. Very nice and helpful staff from my limited interaction with them at check in and out. The food there is very expensive but I would expect that from a 4* hotel. My only complaint was the noise at night. Our room had beautiful large window facing the street where you enter the hotel. We left the window open for the nice breeze when we went to bed but it was very noisy and I closed it around midnight. That helped some, but I could still hear loud car mufflers passing by, people talking in the street, and around 6 AM some type of garbage collection rattling on the cobblestone outside. It was by no means intolerable but if you are a light sleeper, bring earplugs or request a room not on the main road. In short, it's a very nice place if you find a deal booking it, but the normal booking rate of 400+ euro a night would be out of the question for me--if I paid that much I would expect complimentary gifts at check in, a robe and slippers in the room, that type of thing, but you will not find that here.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but expect better for the money”
Reviews.Author: Fabulous_Fabio
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful and could reccommend some great restaurants, especially if you want something romantic or a decent seafood place. Rooms were small for the money and decorated fairly old, but still the bed was comfy. The bath was very difficult to get in and out of with 3/4 of it been shielded by a wall, glad i'm young and agile or this would have been a problem had i been a pensioner!! Location was fairly decent, been no more than a 10-15 minute walk from the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: packer72
Reviews.Content: on our arrival we were assigned a room with a balcony; once entered in our room, I discovered that we had a common balcony with other clients who stayed in the first floor rooms; no privacy and no safety at all. so called french balcony doors had just a tiny lock on them. I called right away to the reception and ask to have an another room without this problem. they said it was no problem and a cleaning lady came very soon to show us way in our new room; same floor, same problem however there was no balcony access just a huge window with the same safety and privacy problems. this felt like they would have been just kidding with us. both of the rooms were extremely dusty and very old fashioned. i run a hotel business myself and i am very familiar with these things. only good thing in this hotel is its location and the quality of toiletries that were in the bathroom; however we received just a small bottle of shower gel and shampoo that were not replaced after the first night. actually it felt like somebody just redid our bed but did not do the necessary daily cleaning in the room because even empty shower gel/shampoo/water bottless were not even removed. well i was not supriced of this after having wiped off almoust a 1 cm layer of dust away from the side boards. while checking out i heard a conversation between a spanish client and a lady working in the reception; this poor client wanted to change his room, but the receptionist refused to hear this and was just repeating that the hotel manager is on vacation. shouldn't there be somebody that replaces him/her? i think that the hassle had something to do with the noise coming from the street side and the receptionist pretended that this client should had been intelligent enough to ask a room on the other side when he made his booking; well, if you are planning to book this hotel be sure that you ask for cleaning as well. the only one who felt honest with a truly honest smile was the darked hair guy who worked in the evening shift.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wormy01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the nh doelen, booked through lastminute.com which was the cheapest price around. it was a last minute trip booked a week in advance, thoroughly enjoyed the hotel staff, the room was very nice, maid service every day, chocolates on the pillow! all very smart and helpful staff. Great location only 5 mins walk from dam square, great little bar/cafe on the corner of the street which was great value whilst watching the world go by, by the river flowing just by it. The only thing we were suprised to notice when we left was that the hotel charges 5.99 euros per night per room of your stay as a hotel room charge which is a dutch thing apparantely so beware. other than great hotel, very smart and really quite posh!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, Fantastic Location and Charming Suite”
Reviews.Author: TrottingDr
Reviews.Content: I had a grand view, a lovely balcony, decent dÃ©cor and an overall pleasant stay. The location is a perfect starting point for making your way around to the most interesting parts of town. I hear that the rooms are small but the suite is ideal value for the money. Most often you get a lot more satisfaction out a 4 star suite than a 5 star superior room. I expect this to be true of most 4 star rated hotels and in this case this logic applies well. You get a Jacuzzi and a great bed, charming historic surroundings and the staff is obliging. Granted there is no ultra modern dÃ©cor but you would not want it to be, the tame, non imposing traditional feel is what makes for a place of character. My partner an I aim to go again the first weekend of August, we will report if our feelings about this place are in any way changed. So to conclude, when you consider the other options available in the city, the suite at this hotel makes great value for the money you pay and an excellent alternative to a 5 star superior room.

Reviews.Title: “I love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lola0210
Reviews.Content: We reached the hotel quite late since our flight from Berlin was delayed.. With little expectation , we were quite surprised to find that the hotel is reasonably good. I've to say that not all of the receptionists are friendly.only a few were. Overall, the hotel is good, i didnt have any problem, the room is great but prob nothing fancy like other hotels..location is great as it's like 5 mins walk to the dam and also red light district. rembrandt is not far , .i couldnt ask for more. Imagine having breakfast facing the canals(which Amsterdam is famous for)..its just great..i couldnt believe why people gave a bad review of this hotel..not like am gonna spend the whole time in bed.as most of my time spent outside shopping, or partying at red lights and rembrandt.. i'd say...good to NH Doelen..

Reviews.Title: “Nice historic hotel, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: alchemista
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location, at the southern part of the city center. The building is historic, it is where Rembrandt's "The Night Watch" was released, and where the officers worked. That is the main draw to the hotel, the history and the older furnishings. We were slightly let down by the room as we were expecting a very nice room for this 4-star and price hotel. However, the room was pretty small and the bathroom was just average. The furnishings in the room were nice though, and you could open the window to go out on the roof. There was no real separator between the outside roof rooms though, so it would have been possible for someone to be peeking in your window or breaking in that way, so be careful with that. The breakfast was excellent, a large elegant buffet, complete with champagne as well! No real negatives to the hotel, just that it was slightly below our expectations. Overall it was good though.

Reviews.Title: “PerfectThis”
Reviews.Author: RomaZs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb... clean, great breakfast and perfect location, right in the center of Amsterdam. Our room was ok, maybe a little bit small, but with a wonderful view on the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Above Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IHeartDingle
Reviews.Content: NH Doelen from the outside is breathtakingly beautiful. It sits nicely right on the Amstel ... My boyfriend & stayed there for 6 nights and although our room was small (it was necessary for us to unpack because there was no where for us to put our suitcases) ... Although the room was small, the bathroom was quiet spacious ... The room and hotel was extremly clean and all in all, we enjoyed our stay! I'd suggest asking for a room at the back of the hotel so you have a nice view of the river ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great location”
Reviews.Author: CrawleyVisitor
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 night stay at this hotel and was a liitle worried about staying after some of the reviews that were posted. Our room was at the front of the hotel and was very spacious with a lovely modern bathroom. The staff were very nice and friendly. A good hotel to stay in as you are within walking distance of Dam Square Anne Frank's house etc. Well worth a visit and will certainly stay again on our next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The absoulte worst hotel in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: LondonJac
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst hotel in the entire city of Amsterdam. Although a good location the actual hotel is appauling. The room size is no bigger than a rabbit hutch. The hotel blub states its old world charm and elegance - to those in the real world it just means dirty and old fashioned. Wallpaper hanging off, a small amount of scribble around the lift plates, chipped laminate flooring in the lift, threadbare carpet. Lets move onto breakfast - cold and miserable, thats just the staff! The food was bland and tasteless which might explain my upset stomach later in the day and subsequent evening. If I could reccommend a hotel to be closed down, fumigated and started again this would be it. Avoid this hotel at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charltonpaul
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in November 2006, the hotel is in a superb location overlooking the canals away from the noisier parts of Amsteradam. There is a nice selection of shops and bars, a short stroll from the hotel. All the staff here were very helpfull, rooms were cleaned every day, breakfast although a bit pricy was very nice. Although the hotel is starting to look a bit tired and could do with updating a little bit, I would thoroughly recomend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in an ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: meggle748
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January 2005 for a 4 night city break with my boyfriend and we couldn't have enjoyed our stay enough! The hotel is located overlooking the canel down a quiet backstreet in the centre of the city. We had a room overlooking the road on the otherside of the canal which was fine and I didn't notice any noise like other tripadvisors did. The room itself was a little bit small but the decor and furniture were all to the standard of what you would expect from a 4* hotel! Breakfast was exceptional with everything you could want from cereals, yoghurt, fruit, cooked, continental etc and there was even champagne and classical music playing in the elegant dining room while you ate! It is situated about an hours drive from the airport but the easiest thing to do is to head to the train station at the airport and head straight to the city centre and its about a 15 minute walk to the hotel or you can simply hop in a cab or on a tram and it will drop you right outside! Amsterdam is a fab city and everything is best explored on foot with the red light district, city centre and Ann Franks house all with easy walking distance. The arts quarter is about a 15/20 minute walk away however but its a lovely stroll so we didn't mind! I thoroughly recommend the canal boat rides and Ann Franks house for things to do but I did find the Van Gogh museum a bit overpriced (but thats my opinion!) Overall this hotel is great if you want to see the sights and sounds that the city has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizzie47
Reviews.Content: The locality of the hotel is excellent overlooking the canal on one side. We stayed in room 218 for two nights and had our own double balcony which was superb. Room was very acceptable as we only paid Â£110 per night including breakfast, which I must say was good value. As far as cleanliness is concerned we did not find the hotel dusty as the previous review stated. Room was cleaned and towels and bedding changed daily. Breakfast was excellent value and a superb view over the canal whilst you are tucking into a hot or cold breakfast. Reception was very accommodating and helpful as we had booked a non smoking and they had allocated us a smoking room, they changed this without too much effort, which is a bonus. I would definately stay at this hotel again mainly due to the locality as the other hotels around Dam Square are noisy from traffic and also they are putting a new metro line in so the cranes and diggers are working all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Doelen Fading?”
Reviews.Author: Profnick
Reviews.Content: Judging by the other reviews (most recent May 06), the Doelen may be having some difficulties. I stayed there for 3 nights with my family in two delux twin rooms over the first weekend in August. It was the Gay Pride Carnival weekend and we expected lots of noise, but with two canal side rooms, (2nd floor and 5th floor) it wasn't too bad and the noise moderated somewhat after midnight. The Hotel seems to have had better times, and the lack of a bar or a restaurant, (though the in-room information still says there is!), means no atmosphere. The rooms are probably 3 Star quality and despite what some other reveiwers have said, the level of cleanliness was barely acceptable, but certainly not 4 star standard.
