The rooms and corridors were dingy and dust and cobwebs were in evidence throughout. All the "extras" were expensive, and overall I got the feeling of "Faded elegance". Compares badly with the excellent Banks Mansion. One bright point was the superb breakfast in what must have been at one time, an impressive restaurant/dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: miss_alice
Reviews.Content: From the minute we got there we knew we';d picked a good one! The lobby is gorgeous all white marble and very well kept. Our room was small, and I would suggest you request a room with a canal view, but other than that it was really clean, comfortable and a lovely escape for when you need to relax away from the city. The only other thing that was slightly negative was that we didn't even realise there was a restaurant until we checked out. Its very hidden and even though room service menus were in the room it not very well advertised. We had an absolutly wonderful five days in amsterdam and this hotel was definitly a big part of that, mainly because of its brilliant location. You can literally walk to everything and we didn't use public transport once. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone. (Its also very reasonable for central Amsterdam).

Reviews.Title: “Slightly above average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a 4 star by any stretch but certainly more than a 3. Room had some nice pieces of furniture but was slightly tatty around the edges. We had a nice balcony but was a bit too cold to stay out there for too long... And certainly wouldn't recommend going there in the height of summer as their idea of air conditioning is a fan on top of the TV... Bed was also very soft and the towels were not 100% clean. On a more positive note, the room had large windows and high ceilings which was quite impressive on entry. We found the staff to be friendly too and didn't have any real complaints about our stay. Location was good as all major attractions were accesible by foot and we only used the tram to get to the station and back with our bags. All in all, hotel was fine for what we wanted but you can get better value for your money than this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Doelen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Seeing as we passed plenty of hotels from arrival at Schipol airport to the City of Amsterdam, ranging from boutique to small B&B's, we were hoping that our hotel would impress.... and it did just that. Situated next to the luxury Europa Hotel on the canal the hotel is rather pleasing on the eye. The interior did not fail to please either. Our room wasn't large, but it was very welcoming and cosy and had everything that we needed for our four day stay. Location-wise we couldn't have asked for more. Only a very short walk from Munt Plein and the trams stops everything was within a short distance in either direction. The staff were friendly and only too pleased to accommodate us when we requested taxis and information. The only downside to this hotel is that is does not have a bar - the only bar in the mini one in your room. However, it does have a wonderful contemporary coffee shop adjoining at the reception which does every latte and cappuccino in the book. If you are looking for a good location, friendly staff, clean rooms and lots of character, then the Doelen has it all. A bonus for us was that we had a canal view room and I must say what a view. We were a short walk from various restaurants, shops and the main attractions, so everywhere was in walking distance. We would not hesitate in staying here again as it made our stay in Amsterdam's wonderful city a very pleasant one. Thank you to the Doelen.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint n' Cozy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a good B&B-type of place in a central location, then this is it. Size is all relative depending on what you're interested in...You don't need much room if you're just sleeping in bed and taking a shower with your loved one. The hotel is very historic-looking with authentic furniture, decor and tapestry. It gives the overall appeal of an early-1900s hotel and doesn't need any special bells n' whistles. I do agree, the walls are thin and noise from the hallways is often heard - but we weren't in the room that often. The breakfast, although a bit pricey, is overall very good - especially the home-made multi-grain bread! It's more than a typical European breakfast; they serve scrambled eggs, mini-pancakes, fresh fruit, cereal, everything. The hotel really is a short walk from many key districts such as Bloemenmarkt (flower mkt), Leidsplein (clubs/bars/nightlife), Rembrandtplein (restaurant row) and the infamous Red Light district. We didn't have to use the tram at all since everything was so close by. The hotel staff was very helpful giving us directions, accomodating our early check-in, and suggesting good restaurants. One tip to suggest though, if you stay here, be sure to put the "Do not disturb" sign on the door, or else an unexpected maid may enter. Overall, had a great time at this hotel and would stay here again. The canal view is lovely. It's a great 3star hotel if that's what you're interested in.

Reviews.Title: “NH DOELEN is ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Noisy Location, not the most clean rooms, front desk was good. Face the canal and ask for a high floor. Central Location

Reviews.Title: “NH Doelen is Great, but Watch out for Canal Mosquitos!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was pleased with the Doelen. However, I would recommend NOT getting a room with a canal view in the warm months when the window needs to be open. The room gets a bit stuffy, so we kept our window open, and as a result we were attacked by canal mosquitos that left giant bug bites unlike any mosquito bites I've ever gotten in the US! The more you scratched, the bigger they got, to the size of about US quarters. And boy did they itch!! Regardless, there is a great coffee shop attached to the Doelen that came in handy quite a bit. The staff were fantastic - real friendly, and the location is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Doelen, Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Goodish location, scrupulouslly clean , helpful, competent staff . No language problems. Dull atmosphere, no bar, no animation, no evening 'socialising' and the room was, overall, SMALL and cramped. The furniture was space-consuming, there were no in-built wardrobe areas as such, so the furniture intruded into the walk-about area. There was no air-conditioning, only an efficient but inadequate fan system, and the TV was ill-positioned such as to be only viewable from a very limited area. The hotel had the general ambience of a commercial rather than a tourist one.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: ToddWebb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and a better value than it's brother and neighbor the NH Schiller on Rembrandt square. As I stated in other reviews, we stayed in 4 different hotelsand all were about equal quality but each had it's own unique quirks. Some quirks were more annoying than others, but none ruined our trip or our hotel experience. This hotel, while a touch off the beatn path, had by far the best view of all our hotels we visited. See picture (I had to lighten it to fit upload). This 3-star hotel was a much better value than it's 4-star sister hotel the NH Schiller.

Reviews.Title: “No respect for tradition”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doelen at least a dozen times between 2000 and 2004, but I will never stay there again. They had a bar/restaurant, the Balmoral, that was an architectural and artistic treasure (in addition to having wonderful food). The new owners, to save a little money, destroyed the Balmoral and all of its lovely details and replaced it with a Coffee Company. No hotel that has so little respect for tradition should be patronized. The Doelen is a hotel to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: ebtrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a non-smoking room at the NH Doelen in late April 2005 and had booked through Lastminute.com, so for Amsterdam the price was reasonable. Desk staff were friendly and spoke good English. Our rate did not include breakfast and we were offered this at 16 Euros per person for a full English breakfast. The room was not one of their better ones (I presume), it was a bit tired and jaded. The room was small and a bit claustrophobic but perfectly adequate if just used for sleeping. The bathroom had once been well presented but now needed refurbishing. It had a large bath with a decent shower attachment as well as a good wash basin area. The room contained a double bed, a small table and two chairs, a mini-bar, a tv and a safe. The wardrobe was a reasonable size but two shelves were taken up by what we first thought was a welcoming half bottle of red wine. Fortunately we discovered the price list hidden behind it before sampling it. There were two small bottles of water on the side table - each labelled with the price of 2.5 Euros. Room service was available with a small menu of food and drink at reasonable prices. The position of the hotel was fine, having plenty of restaurants in the close vicinity and just a twenty minute walk from the station. We stayed for 5 days and the general impression of Amsterdam was that we would return at some stage in the future. It seemed to be a very expensive city (more so than London). As non-smokers it was surprising to find that the smell of marijuana being smoked was quite pleasant when compared with tobacco.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the NH Doelen-Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights in Amsterdam at the NH Doelen. We were delighted with our room (named the Lilly Langtry Salon) which was clean, comfortable and charmingly decorated. The staff was courteous and helpful and the breakfast was good. ------

Reviews.Title: “Great canal view!”
Reviews.Author: Neuforce
Reviews.Content: THe view from my room was worth the stay! The staff was helpful, giving maps, and clear instructions on how to go places. Location is very good, near the flowermarket and shopping streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LCandSC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with some friends for one cold night in January. Great location handy for the central area. Rooms were good (although the hotel did try to sell river view rooms for an extra 25 Euros per room/night!). Breakfast was excellent. Would not hesitate to stay here again. L&S.S&D

HotelInfo.Name: NH Doelen
HotelInfo.Address: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 24, Amsterdam 1012 CP, The Netherlands
